chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel Ceballos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: credit for 66 days time served concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
No contact with victims or any children under the age of 17 unless authorized by agent.

Court ordered the defendant participate in any treatment recommended by the DOC.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Ceballos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (22 pages) GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING commencing 07-08-2015 received and filed.
Bail Refund Packets

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Maria C., Susan C.   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 66 days time served concurrent to any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-No contact with victims or any children under the age of 17 unless authorized by agent
-Court ordered the defendant participate in any treatment recommended by the DOC
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Amended Information filed. Defendant is charged as follows First Degree Sexual Assault of a Child Under the age of 13, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 948.02(1)(e), a Class B Felony.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Atty Joyce contacts the court and requests plea/sentencing date.  Case set for 7-8-2015 at 8:15a.m  ADA Mathy agrees to date.  Defendant to be produced from HOC.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.   Joshua Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
State's Motion for Joinder is argued by counsels.  The court rules that cases can be joined pursuant to 971.12(1).  Court orders cases 15CF643 and 15CF2083 joined for trial.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 Safety Building.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-7-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 8-19-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 7-8-2015.
Defense Brief in Support of Objection to State's Motion to Join cases received and filed.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for Josh Mathy for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew
Atty Johnson is allowed to withdraw as counsel and has given her file to Atty Joyce.
Defense objects to motion for joinder with 15CF2083 at this time but does but does not object to adjournment of jury trial set for 6-8-2015.  The court will convert the trial date to motion date and a new trial will be set when ADA Mathy is present.
State's Motion to Consolidate Cases and Adjourn Trial, received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.
Defendant has been charged with Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child, 15CF2083.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Scheduling conference held.    Case set for final pretrial on 5-21-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-8-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-3-2015.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.   
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/18/15.
